description.narrative:
CERID#s #Promotion of Women Economic Empowerment through VSLAs and livelihood initiatives# project build on the successes of Village Savings and Loan Association (VSLA) model under which savings groups are formed at community level to reduce poverty by financially and socially empowering poor and vulnerable people. CERID intends to expand this programme to Koboko district of with an element of business/livelihoods promotion for vulnerable women with the aim of economically empowering them and building their capacity to improve the wellbeing of their families especially for health and nutrition of their children.
The project will be implemented through the following activities; mobilization of women into VSLAs, Registration of VSLAs with local authorities, capacity gap assessment of aspiring business women, Training for 200 women in Business/ livelihood skills and hands on experience, Identification of business mentors, mentoring of 200 women in business and starting up new business/livelihoods projectventures.

participating-org.narrative:
Community Empowerment and Rehabilitation Initiative for Development (CERID) was established in 2016, under the NGO Act. The organisation was established as a response to community need to have their prioritized needs directly addressed especially the wide spread poverty among women and youth and concerns with health, environment and education. We are a demand driven organisation depending on what the communities we work in seek to have tackled in real time. We aim through our mission to promote and empower communities with Life Skills for self reliance and sustainable Development.
Since our establishment, we have been able to legalize our existence with the National NGO Board and authorities in Koboko District, officially inaugurated our board of Governors, recruited several key staff and volunteers as well as achieved partnerships with donors such as World Wide Fund for Nature, Uganda Country Office (WWF # COU) through Rural Initiative for Community Empowerment # West Nile (RICE-WN) for the renewableenergy project. However, most outstanding achievement to date has been our steady and first progress in institutionalizing key CERID functions with the aim of achieving international organisation operational and management standards especially in areas of program management. We have as such worked closely with a top organisation development and management consultant to ensure CERID arrives at the top of in terms of its organizational capacity and capabilities by the time it is 1 year old. Additionally, as an organisation that has special consideration for women empowerment, we have ensured that at each organisation function, a lady is part of the top leadership as head or assistant. We believe that women empowerment starts within CERID before we extend it to communities. We have ladies as our salaried employees or as volunteers.
Our activities include women and youth economic empowerment to ensure income generation through the creation of Voluntary Savings and Loan Association (VSLAs) managed by the women and youth. The initiative to setup CERID was thought best to have an avenue of redress of issues affecting community members especially poverty, bad hygiene practices, poor leadership skills, environmental degradation characterized by practices that lead to climate change.
2. ACHIEVEMENTS What have been the principal results in the past three years that contribute to significant, structural, sustained and positive improvement in the lives of men, women, girls andboys suffering from poverty, injustice, insecurity and exclusion? CERID has been in operation for a period less than 12 months. However, we have vigorously endeavoured to create various opportunities for the majority power in communities to escape the grip of poverty that has engulfed them. We understand poverty to have various ways in which it emerges, manifests and impacts on those it eventually renders most of the time helpless and less hopeful for a better standard of living, health, education and prosperity. We have since our inception worked with communities to tackle issues of climate change and economic empowerment through our project with RICE that provides women with access to use of renewable energies that contributes to safe guarding their environment as well as a source of income where they are able to trade in our renewable energy stoves. This income though small in amount when put together by various women in Voluntary Saving and Loan Associations has provided them loans to start up business that have opened up a path to lessen poverty in their lives and acquire improved standards of living, afforded better health services and an education for their children besides better nutrition and improved family wide wellbeing.
3. INSTITUTIONAL PURPOSE The Vision: Aresponsible society that unites, develops and transforms the communities
Mission Statement: Promoting and empowering the communities with Life Skills for self reliance and sustainable Development.
Mission: What is the current purpose of the organisation? CERID is currently focussed of contributing to poverty alleviation and environment protection through building capacities of community members especially women and youth to innovate, sustainably utilize available resources (human, financial and natural) to uplift themselves and transform their lives by participating in sustainable economic activity.
Institutional objectives: What are the principal changes the organisation seeks to achieve over the long term? Our prevailing long term principal change we aspire to achieve is captured in our Strategic plan 2017 # 2021 Thematic Area 1 aimed at creating an Enabling Environment of CERID to aid its ability to accomplish its set about Strategic intent. This CERID plans to achieve through increased leadership commitment and involvement, increased availability, accessand accountability for financial resources and strengthened legal and institutional framework for coordination and management of CERID
Field(s) of activity: What are the principal thematic and geographic areas in which the organisation works? Who are the socialactors that benefit from the work?
Theme 1: Economic Empowerment, Governance, Peace <(>&<)> Human rights a) Women and Youth Empowerment Program b) Community Education Promotion (CEP) c) Good Governance and Democracy d) Gender and peace
Theme: 2 Community Health a) HIV/AIDS Prevention, Care and Capacity Building b) Malaria and other disease prevention intervention c) Reproductive Health
Theme 3: Sustainable Agriculture a) Improved commercial Agriculture Theme 4: Environment and Natural Resources a) Renewable energy use
We are currently operational in West Nile district of Koboko. We largely rely on our field coordinator for our outreach programs. Women and youth are the key social actors in our work, community leaders and option leaders
4. STRATEGIC POSITIONING Analyse the environment in which the organisation works? Who are the other relevant social actors, including government and business, and what roles do they play? #In this context, what is unique about the position of the organisation?
CERID has positioned itself as an initiative that focuses on issues affecting communities with a strong element of ensuring that its activities are demand drivenrather than proposal that are generated outside community involvement and desire. This is our unique position and differentiating point, that ensures relevance, buy in and sustainability of our interventions. Our activities in effect reflect the actions that communities want to see being taken to transform their setting. We work with local government authorities for instance Koboko Municipal Council on issues of waste management and attract women, men and youth into actions that foster a harmonious working relationship and responsibility as well as accountability between all social actors in the community for the actions being taken.
